name: InterContinental Mark Hopkins San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mark Hopkins for three nights in March and had a very pleasant stay. The rooms were well appointed and the maid service first class. We were expecting a tiny room after reading reviews on here (particularly as we has booked through hotwire and only paid $109 a night) but the room was spacious enough for a city centre hotel. All the staff were very helpful we couldn't rerally have asked for much more & would certainly recommend others to stay at the Mark.
reviews.title: A touch of style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mark Hopkins for four nights in April, and had a very enjoyable stay there, all in all.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel, good service, great breakfast location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entrance and lobby of the hotel is elegant. The service at check-in was ok. The receptionist was effective, but should have been a bit more attentive and friendly. In general, however, we were very pleased with the service at the hotel.
reviews.title: Continues to be Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many former reviewers have complained about having to wait for a long time for the elevator to arrive. We never experienced this problem, however.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room, a deluxe corner room, on the eight floor was quite nice and had a good view of the northern part of the city. The difference in size between a classic room and a deluxe room is quite minimal, however. (My parents-in-law and my brother, who also stayed at the hotel, stayed in classic rooms). But usually the deluxe rooms have better views than the classic rooms.
reviews.title: Royal Ambassador Stay Less than Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Love the Mark Hopkins - I stayed there recently as I am taking a conference group to San Fran in April 09. It was a wonderful hotel with staff that went the extra mile to accommodate your needs. The bonus use of a Town Car (which the hotel offers free - just tip the driver what you think is fair) was great you may have to wait 15 mins but worth the wait when you driver is "Dave". Who offered great insights into San Fran and was friendly and loved relaying stories on famous guests he had driven (no bad stories just nice ones). The Cocktail bar was the best... cocktails were very cheap (compared to a bar very similar in Sydney Australia) and the service was great too - asked for a cocktail that wasn't on the list and they were happy to make to my specifications (mind you there was 100 cocktails to choose from). The bar snacks were reasonable as well and I can recommend the Corn Chips and dips (fresh, flavoursome and plenty of it).. Hotel in prime location (although recommend you walk down the hills but catch tram or bus back up).
reviews.title: Love the Bar

likes.disliked: — The hills around it (use public transport to get up the hills)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: Its not a cheap hotel but the benefits are worth it....
reviews.title: Historic hotel, great customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Love San Fran and love the Mark Hopkins...
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel! Wow!

likes.liked: — The beautiful decor of the hotel and our room accommodations..of course the staff too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed for one night after an international flight. We were so tired we stayed at the hotel for most of tour stay. We booked directly.
reviews.title: Great location - more business then pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We have ambassador status and our upgrade request was honored.
reviews.title: Worth the price?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Position could not be better for a visit to San Francisco. Very central, directly in front of the cable car. Easy access on foot to Embarcadero, Union Square. No traffic problems when arriving by car. Parking is very pricey, though.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception is professional and friendly. Nonchalently tried to switch our "bay view" room to "city view". However, on our comment we were given a splendid room with view on both.
reviews.title: Pricey, but great location on Nob Hill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was nice, big and well furnished. Spectacular views from 14th floor. Bathroom prone to being flooded by shower but spacy, clean and new.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel at the Top of Nob Hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast in Top of the Mark was superb with great panorama of city and bay below.
reviews.title: Top of the hill and top service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will be back any time!
reviews.title: Top notch, as one would expect...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than drinks at the Top of the Mark, there was not much going on at this hotel, which can be a good... Our room (seventh floor king) was spacious enough for two and very clean. All staff were friendly and helpful upon request, but stayed in the background. We found our own breakfast place (Gallery Cafe across from Cable Car Museum at Mason and Washington) to avoid the high priced spreads offered at this category of hotel. We appreciate being on Nob Hill for its views and for the crisscross cable lines right outside.
reviews.title: Excellent location, very quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 days at the Mark Hopkins San Fran with my nearly 80 year old mother and 5 year old daughter. The hotel is in a prime location for sightseeing - you are literally steps away from 2 cable car lines. We found the Powell lines to be very busy and several had to pass before we could get on and even then our seats didn't really allow us to enjoy the ride. The California cable car line is much less busy and lets you properly take in some sights even if you're not really heading to any of the key tourist spots.
reviews.title: Conveniently located for sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was great especially with the valets and doormen - these guys were very much willing to share about good spots to go to and the easiest way to get there. Sal in particular was very welcoming and outgoing. There's also a cool parkette nearly directly in front of the hotel which was very welcome by my daughter but its also a dog park.
reviews.title: Poor star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of watch outs:
reviews.title: Very pricey, needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: - A plus or drawback depending on your situation but you are located on top of the hill. As a result its very windy and quite a trek to walk the neighbourhood. Some cool shops/bakeries nearby but depending on who you're travelling with, not the easiest climb to get back up the hotel
reviews.title: Past it useful lifetime...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After many nights researching hotels for this trip I decided on the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins. We were so glad we ended up at the Mark Hopkins. Great location, beautiful hotel in Nob Hill.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM
reviews.title: beautiful hotel in quiet nobb hill

likes.disliked: — noise from powell st due to cable car and it's on top of the hill so hard to walk back from union square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Booked the Excutive Level King - Room 1422. This room had a grea view of the Golden Gate Bridge/Bay, Grace Cathedral and California Cable Line. Ask for this room.
reviews.title: Old World Excellence in a convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an older hotel like many in San Francisco but well-maintained and nicely decorated. We didn't find the room to be any smaller than a normal hotel we've stayed in during our travels.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, small rooms
An elegant home in San francisco
reviews.text: CLUB LEVEL A MUST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on priceline for $115 a night in May, there was a big convention in town, so we got a great deal! We are Ambassador member of Intercontinental, and even though we booked through Priceline, we still got an upgrade!! If we booked on the hotels website, it would cost $400 a night!
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is located on Nob Hill, about 10mins walk to Union Square downhill, its a very steep hill, so we have to get taxi (about $7) going back to the hotel every time.
reviews.title: Hotel with a view!

likes.disliked: — Walking to other areas, it's literally a HIKE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was promt and excellent.
reviews.title: Nothing but smiles
The Mark was GREAT!
reviews.text: I had to use the Internet in the room for about $15 a day, and reception isn't good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff was great, the bell-hop greeted me every morning, and when I return he would say "Welcome back!"
reviews.title: Thumbs Up, all round!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: Located on Nob Hill, this hotel is the works for spectacular views of San Francisco.
reviews.title: Top Marks for Top of the Mark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was lucky to have a room on the 17th floor with fanatastic views. The staff could not have been more helpful from check-in to departure. The Club Lounge on the ground floor was a relaxing space to read the newspaper and enjoy an evening night cap. The lounge staff were attentive and helpful (explaining where to catch the best sunsets and how to travel to particular tourist points).
reviews.title: Big price for just so-so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Top of the Mark restaurant is a must with far reaching views while you tuck into breakfast!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel on the Top of the Hill

likes.liked: — Nice rooms, comfy bed and linens
likes.disliked: — Inexperienced front desk girl needs lessons on customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed a very comfortable two night stay and would recommend this hotel and its staff!
reviews.title: Top of the Hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: First the hotel confirmed a price which was much lower than the one advertised. When I called to make sure this wasn't a mistake, they resent a confirmation email. Then when I arrived they quoted the original high price and would not honor their confirmation. The rooms are small for what you pay especially if you get a room at either end of the building. The location is nice for the view but not convenient for getting around the city. The work out area was pretty basic. I would not recommend this place in general.
reviews.title: Beware of overbooking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel suite was lovely. It's an older grand hotel. We got the package with the breakfast etc included and it was well worth it - very nice spread. they had top shelf and champagne in the afternoon as well as snacks throughout the day. Staff was excellent.
reviews.title: Top of the Hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff, with the exception of the doorman, are very unfriendly. I had two rooms reserved there and although I admittedly made the mistake of reserving both rooms "king" when I asked the front desk person if he can change one of them, his response cut me off-guard. He said, and I quote, "you made the mistake, I didn't". He could have said, I am sorry but we are fully booked, I keep looking and if something comes up I will let you know. In another incident, I came out of my room to go to the gym. I asked the housekeeping person for the gym floor and she was struggling with it. An employee in a suite with name tag comes by, does not stop to help so I asked him, sir do you know on which floor the gym is located? His response without turning his head, "California" so I asked him then "C" level, correct?. He turned his head and said, "obviously". The room was good size and bathroom adequate but no water pressure and I mean none on the 5th floor. The sleep quality is non-existent the mattress must have been old and worn out because they had something like a comforter on top of the mattress below the sheet to soften it and made it near impossible to sleep. I will NOT stay there ever again!
reviews.title: Very unfriendly bad sleep quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had initially booked and paid for a standard room online but asked to upgrade to either a deluxe room or a view room upon checking in. I had my credit card in hand, fully expecting to pay the additional charge, but the MH upgraded us to a deluxe room (on a higher floor) at no additional cost.
reviews.title: Nice location, comfortable bed, good night's sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: We had never stayed at the MH before so we didn't quite no what to expect. Some reviews mentioned street noise, thin walls, etc. But from our room on the 11th floor, we heard nothing. The room was nicely furnished and the housekeeping staff kept the room immaculate throughout our stay. The concierge was very helpful, too, recommending a nearby Italian restaurant for dinner one evening and arranging our wine country tour later in the week.
reviews.title: Great Service-Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bed and pillows were very comfortable and we didn't hear any noise from the hallway or either room around us. So we slept great.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some of the horrible reviews we almost cancelled our stay at the Mark Hopkins. I am so glad we didn't! The hotel was beautiful. Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but it is historical so that's how they were built. I found the decor tasteful and the service fantastic. We stayed on the club level which paid for itself during cocktail hour, dessert presentation and breakfast. We loved the location and had a fabulous view. I found the price reasonable ($289) considering I have paid over $300 at a hotel on Union Square without the club level. Also, Union Square is just a cable car ride away. We will definatly stay again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
Not Worth The Price
reviews.text: The lobby is grand and the Top of the Mark is a must see, but the rooms aren't really any more luxurious than a number of boutique European-style hotels down in Union Square, which are a third of the cost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: First, I cannot warn people enough about how difficult your life becomes because of the location. You go up three really steep hilly streets before reaching it from Union Square. You can take the cable car, but the crowds for the cable car are huge. The hotel's own store is miniscule and overpriced. As for the rooms, they are decent, but if you stay in a lower floor, you will sleep only between 1:00am-6:30am because that is when the cable cars run. I would not have a problem if this hotel were priced at a Courtyard rate. But as a luxury hotel, it is ridiculous.
reviews.title: Not on top of their game

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Mark. We stayed in a corner suite for a long-weekend in late Janaury. The service is lacking - from the concierge to the bell service. Our room was fine - very pricey for what you get or lack thereof. Elevator lines can be very very long. Don't get a room near an elevator. Top of the Mark is an experience - once for the view - and drink prices are high, to be expected. There is not a lot of dining within walking distance - you are at the top of the hill. Views are great from the upper floor rooms. You will need to get a cable car or a cab for dinners. Lower rooms will get cable car vibration noise. Check-out lines were long, and the staff not really up to the task at the front desk when it comes to speed. If there on a Saturday, try the market at the Ferry Building.
reviews.title: Lacking the Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite disappointed overall with this hotel. It certainly is not a good representation of an Intercontinetal Hotel. Rooms are drab, awful colours and terrible cheap tacky bedspreads and curtains that would not even close properly so the light will come into the room in the mornings and wake you. Small adequate bathrooms shower not the best! Breakfast is Buffet only at $25 plus tax and tip!!! My husband and I neither eat a big breakfast only cereal, fruit, juice/coffee so its ridiculous to pay $60.00 for that! But they would not even offer al carte after asking and explaining we dont want and cant eat a full buffet breakfast! Anyway we ate out at a GREAT breakfast place just down the street called 'Sears' fine food which is a very popular place, I had oatmeal with banana and maple syrup and coffee and my husband had french toast and strawberries and orange juice the total bill was $23.00 and food is of good quality! The $65 for use of club roon is a total rip off too. The 'Top of The Mark' is quite tacky and very touristy NOT sophisticated, romantic and classy! My experience of similar hotel bars and restaurants with views in Japan for example (up to 80 floors high) was amazing!!! We did not choose to eat in the hotel as the menu was limited and nothing grabbed our fancy but we ate out at some great restaurants including 'Anzu' at the Nikko hotel a couple of times where the food is delicious especially the 'Fillet steak' with wasabi/mustard sauce with sweet potatoe. 'Roys' is always great too! In hindsight we both wished that we had stayed at the 'Nikko' hotel with its smart decor and 'L.C.Ds' in the rooms and there is also a swimming pool, either there or The W hotel for us next year!
reviews.title: Not up to scratch!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights in July on business. Booked via Priorityclub.com and as usual, no problem. Very nice deal including parking ($45/nite) and breakfast at the Top of the Mark every morning ($26/person/day). Upgraded to the corner room upon check-in.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: very nice and clean; great bed; bathtub could have been bigger/shower water pressure could be improved
reviews.title: Excellent customer service from a romantic, charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet: LAN connection - nice and stable throughout the stay
reviews.title: A Superb Hotel

likes.disliked: — Climbing the hill after a night in a bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping: very friendly and flexible to our needs
reviews.title: Old-style snobbery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: very full American breakfast buffet; food very nice but service not so good (could hear staff yelling at each other)
reviews.title: Beautiful View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Architechturally the hotel is beautiful but the staff does not live up to professional standards. I have stayed in Intercontinental Hotels across the world and after my personal experience at this hotel I would never recommend it to anyone nor will I ever stay at another Intercontinental property. I recommend the Fairmont across the street.
reviews.title: Stay across the street at the Fairmont Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our anniversary weekend at the Mark Hopkins. Never having stayed there, but having heard about it my whole life, my expectations were dangerously high. I am pleased to report that the hotel met or exceeded my expectations in every way. The location is very convenient--at the intersection of all three cable car lines--but atop serene and civilized Nob Hill. (Do get a transit pass, by the way--at $5.00 a ride the cable car fares really add up fast). The hotel is old but perfectly maintained, and has all the charm and character you could hope for. Our room, a corner on the 11th floor, was outfitted with all the luxuries you would expect, and more (like an umbrella, clever two-way shades in the bathroom so you could see out but no one could see in, and the newpaper (NY Times, no less) delivered in a cloth bag on your doorknob.) The bed was top-notch, and the bathroom was luxurious and spacious. A small but thoughtful touch: your room key holder has a handy folding city map attached. The Top of the Mark bar is justifiably world famous, and as a hotel guest the cover charge is waived.
reviews.title: Ideal San Francisco Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ICMH is a great city hotel offering the ombiance of old Nob HIll. The location was handy, the hotel staff more than helpful and the breakfast at the Top of the Mark inviting. We spent three days as we visited the City by the Bay and found the hotel perfect in every way.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is rather beautiful, a prime example of one of the old classic fancy historical hotels. It's been renovated and the rooms, beds, bathrooms, etc are all updated nicely. The staff are very friendly and nice, helpful whenever you ask. And, the decor is beautiful in the lobby and all around. I'm not sure why folks have complained about this hotel. The only bad thing was that the room I was in, had a locked, but adjoining room, and on the 2nd and 3rd nights, my neighbor was rather noisy. So, the walls are not the thickest, but that is not the fault of anyone in particular, and frankly this situation of noisy neighbors and thin walls often happens to me at many nice hotels. I think I'm just a light sleeper.
reviews.title: nice hotel at the top of a big hill

likes.liked: — the historical and architectural beauty of the hotel
likes.disliked: — the adjoining room with noisy neighbors and thin walls

reviews.title: Nice hotel - very efficient
reviews.text: In terms of shopping, dining and sightseeing, no it's not right next to anything. The cable car ($5 per ride, no transfers) is right outside the door and cabs are readily available. Chinatown is minutes away down hill. Fillmore St is nearby down the hill on the other side. The Ferry Market Building is at the bottom of the hill (from Chinatown), and on a clear day you can see a great view of the city from the Top of the Mark, which is free to look around in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the first night of an 18 night trip as we had a free night to use (we then moved to the Hyatt Regency where we had 2 free nights- see separate review). We had an upgraded room which had nice touches like a Bose radio and a personal Keureg. The bathroom was gorgeous, as was the view. The service was impeccable, as you would expect. Everyone was friendly. I like staying in these old hotels when I can, it is so different than a chain hotel. Yes, it was very expensive, as were drinks at the Top of the Mark, but it was not overpriced compared to other luxury hotels in San Francisco. It is conveniently located right on the California Cable car line, which we used frequently (be sure to get a daily or multi-day transportation pass!). It is not the most central location if you want to be in the middle of all of the touristy things, but it is easy get to those sites and then return to the Quiet of Nob hill.
reviews.title: Grand Old Hotel did not disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Checking in experience was a little cold/detached, but professional. Pleased we had booked Club Lounge access - we were able to enjoy its facilities, as our room was not ready.
reviews.title: Not top marks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: 'Upgraded' room was small, and excuse offered of, "you have to remember this is an old hotel", not really a sufficient excuse - have stayed in large suites in a number of 'old' hotels, some dating back to the pre-1900s.
reviews.title: A luxury hotel at the top of the HILL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: However, the above excuse/attitude probably sums up the general approach to customers of the staff, notably the General Manager, "You're privileged to be staying here, so any issues you may have are your issues. We'll listen to you in our own aloof and patronising manner, and then ignore your concerns."
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: 'Top of the Mark' was OK, and appeared to possess more genial staff.
reviews.title: If you can pick here!

aka: Intercontinental Mark Hopkins San Francisco Hotel
description: HISTORIC GRANDEUR ON THE CREST OF NOB HILL As splendid now as when it opened to great fanfare in 1926, InterContinental Mark Hopkins San Francisco is one of the city’s finest hotels. Located at the crossing of three cable car lines, the venerable landmark is minutes from Union Square, Chinatown, and the Financial District. Fisherman’s Wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge are short drives away.
